contextId.information: This is a rhetorical question. AT: "It does not make sense for you to go with me." or "You should not go with me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Why will you go with me?

contextId.information: Naomi uses this question to say she cannot have other sons for them to marry. AT: "Obviously it is not possible for me to have any more sons who could become your husbands." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Do I still have sons in my womb for you, so that they may become your husbands?

contextId.information: These are rhetorical questions, which do not expect an answer. AT: "you would not wait until they were grown up so that you could marry them. You would want to marry men now." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: would you therefore wait until they were grown? Would you wait and not marry men now?

contextId.information: This can be reworded as a command. AT: "Listen to me, my daughter!" or "Note well what I am telling you, my daughter!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Are you listening to me, my daughter

contextId.information: Boaz used this question to emphasize what he had already done to help Ruth. AT: "I have given the men strict instructions ... you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Have I not instructed the men ... you?

contextId.information: Naomi probably used this question to remind Ruth of something she had already told her. AT: "he is our relative." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
